documentation.text: @dev Ensures a condition is met before proceeding
@dev Custom error when initial value is not even
@dev Restricts access to the buyer only
@dev Restricts access to the seller only
@dev Ensures function is only called in a specific state

@notice Deploy contract and lock in seller’s initial deposit
 @dev Requires that the sent value is an even number

@notice Abort the purchase and reclaim funds
 @dev Only callable by seller in Created state

@notice Buyer confirms the purchase by depositing double the seller’s amount
 @dev Requires exact 2 * value; moves contract to Locked state

@notice Buyer confirms item was received
 @dev Releases buyer's deposit back to them; transitions to Release state

@notice Seller claims payment after buyer confirms delivery
 @dev Transfers total balance (3 * value) to seller and finalizes contract

devdoc.details: Buyer deposits funds that are only released upon confirmation of delivery.

ValueNotEven().details: Custom error when initial value is not even

abort().details: Only callable by seller in Created state

confirmPurchase().details: Requires exact 2 * value; moves contract to Locked state

confirmReceived().details: Releases buyer's deposit back to them; transitions to Release state

constructor.details: Requires that the sent value is an even number

refundSeller().details: Transfers total balance (3 * value) to seller and finalizes contract

devdoc.title: Secure Purchase Agreement

abort().notice: Abort the purchase and reclaim funds

confirmPurchase().notice: Buyer confirms the purchase by depositing double the seller’s amount

constructor.notice: Deploy contract and lock in seller’s initial deposit

refundSeller().notice: Seller claims payment after buyer confirms delivery

userdoc.notice: Implements a simple escrow contract between a buyer and a seller.
